DataElement.preferredName: Inflammatory Disorder And Autoimmune Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related to autoimmune or inflammatory disorders as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Inflammatory Disease or Disorder And Autoimmune Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to inflammation._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to inflammation.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: And Autoimmune Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis).
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have active or p
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active or prior documented autoimmune or inflammatory disorders (including inflammatory bowel disease (e.g., colitis or Crohn's disease), diverticulitis (with the exception of diverticulosis), systemic lupus erythematosus, Sarcoidosis syndrome, or Wegener syndrome (granulomatosis with polyangiitis, Graves' disease, rheumatoid arthritis, hypophysitis, uveitis, etc.)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active inflammatory bowel disease or connective tissue disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history or risk of autoimmune disease, including, but not limited to, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease, vascular thrombosis associated with antiphospholipid syndrome, Wegener's granulomatosis, Sjögren's syndrome, Bell's palsy, Guillain-Barré syndrome, multiple sclerosis, autoimmune thyroid disease, vasculitis, or glomerulonephritis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have inflammatory bowel disease and abdominopelvic radiotherapy is planned?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or risk of autoimmune disease, including, but not limited to, myasthenia gravis, myositis, autoimmune hepatitis, systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory bowel disease, antiphospholipid antibody syndrome, Wegener granulomatosis, Sjögren syndrome, Guillain-Barré syndrome, or multiple sclerosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active or prior documented autoimmune or inflammatory disorders (including inflammatory bowel disease [e.g., colitis or Crohn's disease], diverticulitis [with the exception of diverticulosis], systemic lupus erythematosus, Sarcoidosis syndrome, or Wegener syndrome [granulomatosis with polyangiitis, Graves disease, rheumatoid arthritis, hypophysitis, uveitis, etc.])?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has PSORIASIS (PSO) AND PSORIATIC ARTHRITIS (PSA diagnosed by a dermatologist or PsA by a rheumatologist and/or by Classification for Psoriatic Arthritis (CASPAR) criteria (Tillett et al., 2012), do they meet the inclusion/exclusion criteria in Appendix K?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has PSORIASIS PsO diagnosed by a dermatologist or PSORIATIC ARTHRITIS PsA diagnosed by a rheumatologist and/or by Classification for Psoriatic Arthritis (CASPAR) criteria (Tillett et al., 2012), do they meet the inclusion/exclusion criteria in Appendix K?
